thread.title: Restaurant offers oyster starter with pearls for $3200
thread.title_full: Restaurant offers oyster starter with pearls for $3200 | Daily Mail Online

author: Sophie Haslett For Daily Mail Australia
title: Restaurant offers oyster starter with pearls for $3200
text:
Just last year, people balked at the idea of forking out AUD $600 for a set menu at the uber trendy Danish restaurant, Noma's pop up, in Sydney .
But it turns out we've seen nothing yet.
In honour of Valentine's Day, diners at the Bistro Remy restaurant within the Langham Hotel in Sydney's CBD can enjoy two 'freshly shucked' oysters - each containing an 'Australian South Sea pearl'.
The delicious-sounding dish doesn't come cheap. The Valentine's Day delicacy will set you back a whopping $3,200.
Delicacy: In honour of Valentine's Day, diners at Bistro Remy in Sydney can enjoy two 'freshly shucked' oysters - each containing an 'Australian South Sea pearl' (pictured); for $3200
'We wanted to take the traditional, romantic dinner for two and make it something extraordinary,' Executive Chef at Bistro Remy, Dave Whitting, said.
'Pearls are known in mythology to strengthen relationships, so are the perfect accompaniment to our limited edition Valentine's Day entrée.'
He added that you can also get your hands on the oysters without the pricey pearls enclosed.
A single oyster at Bistro Remy will set you back $4.50.
Occasion: 'We wanted to take the traditional, romantic dinner for two and make it something extraordinary,' Executive Chef at Bistro Remy, Dave Whitting, said (pictured: Bistro Remy)
The dreamy dish has been touted as 'Australia's most romantic Valentine's Day dish', and the restaurant have ordered in 600 oysters especially for the occasion.
Bistro Remy have not disclosed how many pearls have been pre-ordered.
But a spokesperson said that the premium supplier in Western Australia had 'set aside an allocation of these world-renowned South Sea pearls for chef, Dave Whitting, to use at his disposal for the entrée'.
Preparing ahead: The dreamy dish has been touted as 'Australia's most romantic Valentine's Day dish', and Remy Bistro have ordered in 600 oysters especially (stock image)
De rigeur: This isn't the first time that Sydney has defied expectations when it comes to pricey food; Noma had a pop-up in Sydney where the set menu was around $600 (stock image)
This isn't the first time that Sydney has defied expectations when it comes to pricey food.
As well as the Noma $600 pop-up menu, Heston Blumenthal's Fat Duck pop-up in Melbourne exceeded $500 for the set menu.
